actions.committee: Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs (Formerly:  Post Office and Civil Service)
actions.text: Rereferred to Senate Committee on Governmental Affairs (Formerly:  Post Office and Civil Service).

official_title: A bill to provide that any increase of pay for any Member of Congress under any law, plan, or recommendation shall not take effect until the Congress following the expiration of the term of office of such Member during which such increase would otherwise take effect.

summary.text: Delays increases in the pay of Members of Congress authorized pursuant to the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1946 and the Federal Salary Act of 1967 until the first day of the Congress next after the one in which such pay increases was proposed.

titles.title: A bill to provide that any increase of pay for any Member of Congress under any law, plan, or recommendation shall not take effect until the Congress following the expiration of the term of office of such Member during which such increase would otherwise take effect.
